node.display_long_description:
跨越新的维度，探索神秘岛的各个超现实纪元！

欢迎来到神秘岛：阴谋与背叛，为这座美丽的小岛染上了一片奇幻而神秘的色彩。不妨登岛冒险，探索更深层次的联系，揭开家族背叛背后的残酷真相吧。

继大受欢迎的经典游戏系列《神秘岛》之后，独立工作室Cyan又对其进行了重新构思与全面重制，推出了备受期待的VR版。该版本采用全新的美术设计、音乐、互动方式以及可选随机谜题，并可通过Oculus Quest畅玩，定能为玩家带来不一样的神秘岛VR体验。


开启纪元之旅，破解各种谜题，成为传奇故事中的一部分。

latest_supported_binary.change_log:
Hello, everyone! Our "Translations Achieved" Patch (Patch 3) for Myst on Quest is now out!

We are happy to announce that for the first time ever, all text/subtitles in Myst have been fully localized for various languages (more information on that below).

Achievements are now a part of the game as well, in case you are seeking an extra challenge to collect them all!

We are planning a future patch for our journaling/screenshot system, but in the meantime, you can continue to use the Oculus system-level screenshot tool to take note of what you see in the game.

Everywhere
- Fixed a few more polygons
- Fixed a few more textures
- Fixed a few more meshes
- Fixed a few more collisions
- Fixed a few more LODs
- Fixed a few more paging issues
- Added Achievements

Interface
- Added localization (French, Italian, German, Spanish (Latin America), Portuguese (Brazil), Korean, Japanese, & Chinese (Simplified))
- Fixed drawers being over-pulled

Main Menu
- Added an option to teleport to a safe spot to avoid stuckage
- Fixed menus - no opening while teleporting

Myst Island
- Fixed grabbing a book after... it might not be there
- Fixed a disappearing Selenitic book 
- Fixed a sound issue with Achenar's chest

- Fixed the interior of planetarium from magically vanishing

Mechanical
- Fixed the elevator door closing on player... to avoid injury
- Fixed the exhaust sound not being played sometimes

Stoneship
- Fixed lighting in the generator and Achenar's room
- Fixed - no more standing on Sirrus' desk

Selenitic
- Fixed a lighting issue with the mazerunner

Channelwood
- Fixed the disappearing book room elevator handle

node.reviewDescription:
Update: Patch 1.3 is out and it doesn't have a journaling system even though every single review here said the game is unplayable without it. Instead Cyan concentrated on localization. KNOW YOUR CUSTOMERS!  Where are your priorities Cyan?
---
As far as worthy games, Myst is probably in the top 10 of all Quest games. That's against stiff competition including Walking Dead: Saints & Sinners and The Room VR. The environments and artistry are genuinely breathtaking, there's some excellent world building, and the puzzles are challenging yet solvable if you are observant and think about the clues, especially those found in the library.  This type of gameplay might not be for everybody but it's the reason I bought my Quest. 

Myst island is a visual and aural feast. (I'm holding off exploring other locations until the next patch.) Most textures, like the brick work and floor tiles, are crisp and look so shiny you want to eat a meal off them. There's a few muddy textures here and there but it doesn't ruin the experience. The water looks so inviting I want to jump in. The clouds in the sky are pretty cool the way they move and distort. And that music!

Some of the other reviews here state that Myst was making them sick. I brushed this off at first because I'm able to play Walking Dead for hours with no ill effects, and that includes lots of running and turning. But within minutes of my first Myst playthrough I noticed I didn't feel good. Other games with free locomotion sometimes have a VR sickness option via the "tunnel" effect, where your peripheral vision is cut down while moving. I hope the devs consider incorporating this option as it doesn't look too hard to implement in the Unreal engine.

I won't belabor the lack of note taking since Cyan has stated it is on the way. Can't wait to see it! This game is 4 stars at the moment but could become 5 stars if they deal with a few key issues that would elevate it.
